meanings.definition: The act of treating someone as a celebrity or hero.
meanings.sent1: The lionization of the actor made him feel like a superstar.
meanings.sent2: Her lionization in the media led to a surge in popularity.
meanings.sent3: The lionization of the chef's cooking skills was so over the top, it made him blush.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, her lionization was akin to being crowned queen.
meanings.sent5: The lionization of the athlete's achievements was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The process of making someone famous or well-known.
meanings.sent1: Through constant media coverage, the singer's lionization spread far and wide.
meanings.sent2: The lionization of the author's work brought it to the attention of a global audience.
meanings.sent3: The lionization of the new product launch was so effective that everyone knew about it.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden lionization in the art world took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The lionization of the scientist's groundbreaking research was well-deserved.

meanings.definition: The act of praising or admiring someone excessively.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's lionization of the student's achievements motivated others to excel.
meanings.sent2: His lionization of her talents bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent3: The lionization of the politician's speeches sometimes felt insincere.
meanings.sent4: Her lionization of the singer's voice knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The lionization of the artist's work was evident in the crowded gallery.
